patterns: What‚Äôs up with my chest pain?

patterns: What to do in an emergency?
When to go to the ER?

responses: In an emergency, call your local emergency number! Don‚Äôt drive yourself.
Head to the ER for severe pain or breathing issues. Don‚Äôt wait on that!
For CPR, call for help, check if they‚Äôre responsive, and do chest compressions.
Stroke signs? Look for sudden numbness, confusion, or trouble speaking. Call for help fast!
If someone‚Äôs choking, encourage them to cough. If they can‚Äôt, do the Heimlich and call for help!
For seizures, ensure the person is safe and time the seizure. Don‚Äôt hold them down!
Your first aid kit should have band-aids, antiseptic, gauze, and scissors.
Signs of an allergic reaction include hives, swelling, or difficulty breathing. Call for help immediately.
If someone faints, lay them down and elevate their legs. Keep them comfortable.
Call 911 if someone is unresponsive, having chest pain, or severe bleeding.

patterns: What‚Äôs the best way to manage diabetes?

For migraines, keep a headache diary, stay hydrated, and avoid triggers.
Coping with depression? Reach out for support and talk to a healthcare professional.

With heart disease, follow a heart-healthy diet, exercise regularly, and avoid smoking.
